column4: how can i prevent ubuntu from recreating the default folders that i manually deleted (like ~/Music, ~/Pictures, etc...) every time it reboots?
It does not re-create the default folders for me everytime I reboot or shut down.  That generally don't happen.
rangzy: jaunty shows me a dialog window that offers me to recreate them every time i log in.
The user folders update is just a quick script that runs on startup that makes sure you have the Documents/Music/etc. folders and that they're appropriately translated to your language.
